childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 2 pounds oxtail or beef tripe, cut into serving pieces (you can also use beef stew meat or beef shanks)
  • 1 cup peanut butter
  • 1/2 cup ground roasted peanuts (optional for added texture)
  • 2 tablespoons annatto seeds (achuete)
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 eggplants, sliced into thick pieces
  • 1 bundle bok choy or pechay (Chinese cabbage)
  • 2 cups string beans (sitaw), cut into 2-inch pieces
  • 4 cups beef broth
  • 2 tablespoons cooking oil
  • Fish sauce (patis) or salt, to taste
  • Shrimp paste (bagoong), for serving (optional)
  • Steamed rice, for serving

Instructions:

  1. In a large pot, boil the oxtail or beef tripe in water for about 1 to 2 hours or until tender. You can also use a pressure cooker to speed up the cooking process.

  2. In a separate pan, heat the cooking oil over medium heat. Add the annatto seeds and allow them to release their color, stirring occasionally. Remove the seeds from the oil and discard.

  3. In the same pan, sauté the minced garlic and chopped onion until softened and fragrant.

  4. Add the boiled oxtail or beef to the pan and sauté for a few minutes to incorporate the flavors.

  5. Pour in the beef broth and bring it to a simmer. Cover the pot and let it cook for about 30 minutes to further tenderize the meat.

  6. Stir in the peanut butter and ground roasted peanuts, mixing well to dissolve the peanut butter. Simmer for another 10 minutes.

  7. Add the eggplants, string beans, and bok choy to the pot. Cook for an additional 5 to 7 minutes or until the vegetables are tender but still slightly crisp.

  8. Season with fish sauce or salt to taste. Adjust the seasoning according to your preference.

  9. Remove from heat and transfer the Kare-Kare to a serving dish.

  10. Serve the Kare-Kare with shrimp paste on the side, along with steamed rice.

Enjoy your flavorful and hearty Kare-Kare for dinner!
